posts.post_content: Bought a playset as soon as I could. The great thing about it is its 5 power for a cost of ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol). That's a fourth of your opponent's life, on top of a great hate ability. In an all-artifact deck, it's hard to find a more economical beater. And yes, it can be Bolted. Lots of things can be Bolted. Every card has vulnerabilities; I don't think the fact that Lightning Bolt kills this card completely invalidates it.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: [Juggernaut](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juggernaut) for aggro, [Lodestone Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lodestone Golem) for control. I bet you'll see each one in Standard on opposite sides of the coin. Juggernaut will get played for RDW and anything that wants to get around [Wall of Omens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Omens), and Lodestone for U/W control and things that want to stroll at a more leisurely pace.

Posted By: TheWrathofShane (4/14/2012 9:47:35 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is powerful enough for vintage artifact decks. Frequently dropable on the first turn with [mishra's workshop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mishra's workshop) and any other acceleration like the moxes, or a [sol ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sol ring). These decks used to run [Juggernaut](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juggernaut) (there was nothing better!) and this is a clear improvement. Sure, you would prefer your [Tangle Wire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tangle Wire)s, or [trinisphere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=trinisphere) first turn, but this combines the price increase mechanic that is necessary to win, with your actual win condition!
posts.html:
This card is powerful enough for vintage artifact decks. Frequently dropable on the first turn with mishra's workshop and any other acceleration like the moxes, or a sol ring. These decks used to run Juggernaut (there was nothing better!) and this is a clear improvement. Sure, you would prefer your Tangle Wires, or trinisphere first turn, but this combines the price increase mechanic that is necessary to win, with your actual win condition!

posts.post_content: This card is great. It can slow down your opponents spells and give them a hard time choosing between removal or playing something else. Even if you're fighting an opponent who uses artifacts, hes still a great attacker and blocker with a great cost. With more of these guys out, [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) or [Naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naturalize) can cost a potential 6 mana. Now that hurts.
